thread.title: Not even The Flash's Grant Gustin can get into Comic-Con parties: 'I got shutdown' - The Flash Cult
thread.title_full: Not even The Flash's Grant Gustin can get into Comic-Con parties: 'I got shutdown' - The Flash News - Cult - Digital Spy

author: Justin Harp
title: Not even The Flash's Grant Gustin can get into Comic-Con parties: 'I got shutdown' - The Flash Cult
text: If you've been stuck on the outside looking in at any of Comic-Con's star-studded panels or parties, The Flash's Grant Gustin feels your pain.One would think that being the fastest man alive and star of his own DC series would give Grant free reign over the San Diego event – but that's not actually the case.During an appearance on Late Night with Seth Meyers, Grant made light of being turned away from an exclusive party on the night of his first Comic-Con panel."Comic-Con was full raging, and we were turned away [from this party] because it was capacity," the actor recalled. "[We were told], 'For the guests' safety, there's no room'. They shut us down at the door!"Thankfully, a friendly run-in with Seth Meyers in the halls of Comic-Con turned around the scarlet speedster's night. © The CW / Dean Buscher Consider this a confidence booster – not even superheroes are guaranteed an invite at the pop culture convention.Late Night with Seth Meyers airs weeknights on NBC.
